snippet: As episodes of online hacking have become even more startling, the company has been evolving to confront security threats and improve how information is shared.
abstract: Microsoft chief executive Satya Nadella gives speech to technology workers in government addressing way Microsoft has improved its ability to handle computer security threats; shift reflects how discussions about security have gone from being taboo to marketing plus, and dovetails with company's focus on expanding its cloud computing division.

byline.contributor: Nicole Perlroth contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: As episodes of online hacking have become even more startling, the company has been evolving to confront security threats and improve how information is shared.

headline.main: Microsoft Sheds Reputation as an Easy Mark for Hackers
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Sheds Reputation as an Easy Mark for Hackers
